item.title: XOR
item.description: XOR Basics Exclusive or – ‘XOR’ – is a Boolean binary operator that is true when either the first input or the second input, but not both, are true. XOR is a ‘programmable inverter’: one input bit decides whether to invert the other input bit or to just pass it through unchanged. ‘Inverting’ bits is also called ‘flipping’ bits. \(X = A \bigoplus B\) Properties
